text:
John Stamos ' s ‘Full House’ Son Had the Best Response to His Baby News

Just yesterday, we learned that John Stamos is going to be a dad IRL. And now, his TV son is opening up about Uncle Jesse’s parenting potential.

In a recent interview with E! News, Blake Tuomy-Wilhoit, who played Nicky Katsopolis on Full House, reacted to Stamos’s baby news and revealed he has high hopes for the soon-to-be dad. He said, “I recently heard the news about John and Caitlin’s baby on the way. A huge congratulations! He is going to be a great father. I mean, look at me, I turned out great.”

Tuomy-Wilhoit appeared on the hit ABC show alongside his brother, Dylan (Alex Katsopolis), from 1992 to 1995. The 27-year-old actors later revived their roles on the first season of Fuller House.

Aunt Becky would be so proud.

RELATED: Things Are Looking Up for D.J. & Steve in ‘Fuller House’ Season 3 Trailer
title: John Stamos's 'Full House' Son Nicky Reacts to Baby News
